page.title: 14THE MUSEUM
page.content: We talked to Stephen Cluse who has been the Assistant Curator at the Corinium Museum for 4 years. He has a degree in archeology. He enjoys his job because of the variety of the many different displays and exibitions. He believes that the Saxon Burial Ground at Lechlade was a very important find for the area. In 1984 the museum had 66,600 visitors. Fridays are the quietest days; Saturdays visitors ask the most difficult questions. Many school parties visit the museum,so do individuals from home and abroad,also many local people.Visitors to the museum like the roman mosaics, the stuffed animals,roman statues and skeleton man.Pupils from this school helped to wash the mosaics with distilled water last time they were cleaned.
